page.title: 02LIVING IN CARTHORPE
page.content: I am an 11 year old boy who lives in Carthorpe. My house is at least 10 years old. At the weekend I get up at about 8 o'clock, get washed and dressed, have my breakfast, and go down to the pub to bottle-up. This means that I fill up the shelves that have been emptied the night before. Sometimes this takes me about half an hour, sometimes about two hours. That is how I earn my pocket-money. After work I go to find Michael and Phillip and we play Tiggy-on-high, which is off ground Tig. The one who is {on }has to touch the others before they get off the ground. We then go on our bikes for a while. Later we play in a little quarry we have made. We move soil around with toy tractors and dumpers. We sieve the soil to make the tracks. Last week a wagon went over it and filled it all in.
